/ 10 cm sport/dk weight 21 sts x 28 rounds = 4 / 10 cm worsted weight 18 sts x 24 rounds = 4 / 10 cm bulky weight 15 sts x 20 rounds = 4 / 10 cm *gauge is not critical for this pattern however you may use less or more yarn if you have a tighter or looser gauge than what is suggested techniques two special techniques used in this pattern are the provisional cast on and kitchener stitch below are links to video tutorials to demonstrate how to work each technique provisional cast on https //youtu be/emzykx1pqu4 kitchener stitch https //youtu be/dsbbmdqiahu abbreviations bor beginning of round co cast on m marker st s stitch es rs right side ws wrong side 2 #sohoscrunchie © tori yu 2023 instructions with waste yarn co the sts indicated below for your yarn weight using the provisional co method fingering weight 96 sport/dk weight 84 worsted weight 72 bulky weight 60 with main yarn knit one round place bor m and join in the round knit until work measures 2 4 6 / 5 10 15 cm flip your work inside out so the ws is facing out remove the waste yarn from your provisional co and pick up live sts from the co edge with another circular needle add your hair elastic and fold your work so the rs is facing out again see images below finishing cut yarn with 48 / 122 cm tail and graft rem sts together using kitchener stitch weave in ends and your new scrunchie is done and ready to be worn
